title: 109_hr1871
content: The Act may be cited as the "Volunteer Pilot Organization Protection Act of 2006" and its purpose is outlined in the findings. The Volunteer Pilot Organization Protection Act of 2006 aims to support nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations by addressing their liability risks and promoting their activities for public benefit. These organizations provide valuable services to communities and individuals, offering long-distance transportation in times of special need and supporting homeland security efforts during national emergencies. The Volunteer Pilot Organization Protection Act of 2006 supports nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit, providing transportation for financially needy medical patients and other humanitarian purposes. The Volunteer Pilot Organization Protection Act of 2006 provides liability protection for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit. The Volunteer Protection Act of 1997 is amended to include liability protection for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit, as long as the volunteer was properly licensed and insured and not involved in terrorism. The Volunteer Protection Act of 1997 is amended to provide liability protection for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit, excluding acts of terrorism, and ensuring volunteers have proper licensing and insurance. The Volunteer Protection Act of 1997 is amended to provide liability protection for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit. Nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations and their staff are not liable for harm caused by volunteers while flying for the organization's purpose, as long as the volunteer is properly licensed and has insurance. The Volunteer Protection Act of 1997 is amended to provide liability protection for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations. Referring agencies must ensure volunteers have insurance and proper licensing when operating aircraft for disaster relief services. The Attorney General is required to conduct a study on insurance availability for nonprofit volunteer pilot organizations flying for public benefit. The study will determine if these organizations can obtain insurance, the terms of such insurance, and the impact of not being able to obtain insurance on their operations. A report with findings, conclusions, and recommendations will be submitted to Congress. Passed the House of Representatives on July 17, 2006. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
